etymologies: mid 16th century: from Malay sagu (originally via Portuguese)

definitions: edible starch which is obtained from a palm and is a staple food in parts of the tropics. The pith inside the trunk is scraped out, washed, and dried to produce a flour or processed to produce the granular sago used in the West.
shortDefinitions: edible starch which is obtained from palm and is staple food in parts of tropics

definitions: a sweet dish made from sago and milk.
shortDefinitions: sweet dish made from sago and milk

definitions: the palm from which most sago is obtained, growing in freshwater swamps in Southeast Asia.
shortDefinitions: palm from which most sago is obtained, growing in freshwater swamps in SE Asia

definitions: any of a number of other palms or cycads that yield a similar starch.
shortDefinitions: several palms or cycads which yield starch similar to sago
